# Canadian Air and Precipitation Monitoring Network – Saturna

## Overview

Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC) invites bids for the Canadian Air and Precipitation Monitoring Network – Saturna, a contract requiring daily technical support for the collection and processing of precipitation and air samples. The successful contractor will be responsible for maintaining a research and monitoring station on Saturna Island, British Columbia.

## Description of Work

The contract involves the collection of precipitation and air samples daily, Monday to Sunday, 52 weeks per year, and the processing of the samples according to the Canadian Air and Precipitation Monitoring Network (CAPMoN) Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs). The successful contractor is responsible for:

1. Maintaining, repairing, and replacing equipment as required.
2. Interpreting and recording data from automatic and manual samplers.
3. Shipping samples to designated laboratories for analysis.
4. Performing routine site maintenance tasks, including cleaning the sample hut, clearing snow, and grass cutting.

## Obligations and Deliverables

The contractor is obligated to perform the tasks outlined above and provide regular reports of activities and outcomes. The contractor will also be responsible for receiving preprinted manifests, preparing samples for shipping, and delivering the samples to or picking them up from the designated courier.

## Selection Criteria

The selection of the contractor will be based on the lowest price.
